Title: Administrative Officer
Location: Room 302, 3/F., West Wing, Justice Place, 11 Ice House Street, Central, Hong Kong.
About Company:
The Hong Kong Society of Notaries is seeking a qualified person for the post of Administrative Officer for its secretariat.
The Hong Kong Society of Notaries is the professional association for notaries public in Hong Kong. It was incorporated in 1977 as a company limited by guarantee. It administers Part IV of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Chapter 157 of the Laws of Hong Kong).
A notary public is a solicitor with at least 7 years post-admission qualification before being eligible for appointment as a notary public by the Chief Judge of the High Court of Hong Kong. A practising notary public must also hold a membership of our Society. The majority of our members are senior lawyers with 15 to 20 years post-admission qualification as solicitors.
Notaries Public are primarily concerned with the preparation and authentication of documents for use abroad under the Hague Apostille Convention or via legalization by consulates in Hong Kong. Notaries Public are widely recognised internationally.
For more information, please visit our website at www.notaries.org.hk.
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Secretary General
Address: Room 302, 3/F., West Wing, Justice Place, 11 Ice House Street, Central, Hong Kong.
Note:
Starting salary not less than HK$25,000 per month.
Law would be 1st preference.
Work experience not essential but would be an advantage.
Interested parties please send your application with detailed CV, present and expected salary to Secretary General, Hong Kong Society of Notaries, Room 302, 3/F., West Wing, Justice Place, 11 Ice House Street, Central, Hong Kong no later than 31 August 2024.
Our Society is an equal opportunity employer. Personal data is collected for recruitment purpose only and shall be treated in strictest confidence. Information of unsuccessful candidates shall be destroyed within six months from the date of recruitment.

Title: Personal Tutor
Job Description: Part-time job for undergraduate or university students who have hearts in helping students of all levels to finish their homework and revision after normal school hours. To help students to prepare for tests and exams of all subjects they are studying. Working hours will be Monday to Saturday afternoons from 2pm to 6:30pm.
Skills & Requirements: Undergraduates or university students who studying in Education or similar fields with love and care for children is a must. Tri-lingual candidates who can speak Cantonese, Putonghua and English is ideal. Good time keeping and willing to help children to build up their initiatives will be prioritise considered for interview.
About Company:
Our center offers one-on-one or small group professional training for individuals from aged two and a half to adults who are interested in learning Cantonese, Mandarin, English language arts, and obtaining corresponding language certificates or participating in competitions. We aim to enhance their confidence and adaptability in language stage arts and their basic language skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Our courses include Mandarin GAPSK level tests, English IELTS level tests, as well as Cantonese, Mandarin, and English solo and duet recitations in Hong Kong Schools Music and Speech Festival, including poetry, prose, and drama scripts, and various language arts competitions and tests. We provide tailor made and targeted professional training and advice to students to help them achieve excellent results at all levels. Our center also provides patient and professional guidance and explanations to parents of young and teenage students to help them understand their children's learning situation and address their concerns, ultimately achieving a win-win situation for students, parents, and schools. Courses including after school homework tutorials, and language training in groups and individual also available.

本中心為有興趣學習粵語、普通話、英語語言藝術及考取相應語言證書或參加比賽的兩歲半至成年人提供一對一或小組的專業訓練。提升他們對語言舞台藝術的自信心及臨場表現應變能力，聽、說、讀、寫基本語言基礎訓練。課程包括普通話GAPSK水平測試，英語IELTS水平測試及香港校際音樂及朗誦節粵、普、英獨誦及對誦，包括（詩詞、散文、戲劇節錄）及各大語言藝術比賽及測試。為學員提供度身訂造有針對性的獲得各級優異成績的專業訓練及意見。本中心更會針對青少年學員家長提供耐心專業輔導及講解以幫助他們了解家中小孩的學習情況，解答他們的疑慮，最終達致學生、家長、學校三贏的效果。我們的課程包括團體或個人功課輔導及兩文三語語言培訓。

Title: Junior Business Analyst
Job Description:
Overview
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Business Analyst to join our vibrant Business Solution Team. This entry-level position offers an exciting opportunity for a recent graduate to learn and grow in the field of business analysis. The Junior Business Analyst will work closely with senior team members to assist in analyzing business processes, gathering requirements, and contributing to the successful implementation of business solutions.
Key Responsibilities
Requirement Gathering and Documentation:
Collaborate with senior team members to gather and document business requirements
Assist in the preparation of comprehensive project documentation
Data Analysis Support:
Work with data analysts to analyze and interpret data sets
Contribute to ensuring data quality and accuracy
Process Mapping Assistance:
Support the mapping of current business processes and assist in identifying areas for improvement
Contribute to the design of optimized business processes
Stakeholder Communication:
Facilitate communication between business and technical teams
Assist in conducting status meetings and providing updates on project progress
Testing and Validation Support:
Assist in the development of test cases and participate in user acceptance testing
Validate that solutions meet business requirements and address identified issues
Documentation Maintenance:
Maintain and update project documentation, ensuring its accuracy and relevance
Ensure documentation is accessible to relevant stakeholders
Learning and Development:
Actively engage in learning opportunities to enhance business analysis skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members to accelerate professional growth
Skills & Requirements:
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field
Relevant internship experience or project work is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Eagerness to learn and contribute to a collaborative team environment
Basic understanding of project management methodologies and tools
Exposure to CRM, ERP, or BI concepts is a plus
Fields of Study: Business Administration, Information Engineering, Information System Management, Information Systems & Analytics, Computer Science & Engineering
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Doctorate or above, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor
About Company: The B.S.C. Group is the region's leading interior contractor, retailer of upmarket bathroom and kitchen products as well as supplier of finishing building materials, hotel requisites, and furniture and fixtures with a multitude of high profile regional developments to its name. In order to meet the demands of growth in our product development and supply chain management business, we are proud to present unique and rewarding career opportunities to talented individuals. We now invite talented individuals aspiring for a colourful career path to join us.
Address: 19th Floor, Sino Favour Centre, 1 On Yip Street, Chai Wan, Hong Kong
Note:
We offer an attractive remuneration package and comprehensive fringe benefits including a 5-day work week, 14 days of annual leave, medical insurance, and a discretionary bonus to the right candidate.
Interested parties, please apply with a full resume and expected salary to the Human Resources Department, 19th Floor, Sino Favour Centre, 1 On Yip Street, Chaiwan, Hong Kong, or by clicking the 'Apply Now' below. For more information about us, please visit our website http://www.bschk.com.
Job Categories:
Management Consultant / Business Analyst
IT / Programming

Title: Business Banking Intern
Location: Unit 1302-03, Level 13, Core F, Cyberport 3, 100 Cyberport Road, Hong Kong
Job Description:
Assist on daily operation for business banking, including loan drawdown, document checking, report preparation and financial spreading etc.
Assist on preparing monthly report to track business performance and provide market update to RM team
Assist on handling general enquiry from borrowing customer
Assist on credit proposal preparation
Inputting customer's data into the core banking system accurately and efficiently
Communicating with customers to gather necessary information for periodic review/ amendments and ensuring that these are completed in a timely manner
Collaborating with RM to gather required documentation to onboard the new relationship to the bank
Providing excellent customer service by answering customer inquiries and addressing any issues that may arise during the account opening process
Assist on product development for business banking, including account opening, lending, channels, APIs etc
Assist on identifying metrics and building business dashboard to track business performance
Assist on other innovation projects
Skills & Requirements:
Undergraduate or postgraduate degree in school, majors are not limited
Have a strong interest in fintech and digital banking, and have a certain understanding of money transfer products and services
Familiar with office software, such as Excel and PPT
Good communication and coordination skills, able to work effectively with team members and other departments
Serious and responsible, with strong learning ability and problem-solving ability
About Company:
ZhongAn Technologies International Group Limited (“ZA International”) was established in Hong Kong in December 2017 by ZhongAn Online P & C Insurance Co., Ltd. (HKEX stock code: 6060), an online-only insurtech company in China, to explore international business development, collaboration and investment opportunities in the areas of fintech and insurtech in overseas markets. In August 2018, ZA International and SoftBank Vision Fund announced cooperation to boost ZhongAn’s technology solutions businesses outside China, with an initial focus on Asia. In September 2018, ZA International announced that it would support the digital transformation of Sompo, a Japanese insurance giant, with its next-generation insurance system built upon end-to-end cloud technologies. In January 2019, ZA International and Grab, Southeast Asia’s leading online-to-offline mobile platform, announced the establishment of a joint venture to enter the digital insurance distribution business in the region. In Oct 2021, ZATI raised USD230m+ in Series A funding from investors including AIA and Chow Tai Fook, and became a home-grown HK FinTech unicorn. 

On 24 March 2020, ZA Bank, a subsidiary of ZA International, officially became the first virtual bank in Hong Kong, providing Hong Kong customers with banking products and services that break conventions and time boundaries. On 4 May 2020, ZA Life Limited, a joint venture between ZA International and Fubon Life Insurance (Hong Kong) Company Limited, was granted a digital-only insurer license by the Hong Kong Insurance Authority under its Fast Track pilot scheme, operating under the trade name “ZA Insure”. It aims to serve the needs of different people with innovative insurance services and products, offering protection to a wider population.
Address: Unit 1302-03, Level 13, Core F, Cyberport 3, 100 Cyberport Road, Hong Kong

About Company:
Kering Eyewear is the world leader in Luxury and Hi-End Eyewear (Frames & Sunglasses), developing a unique ‘ensemble’ of powerful brands.We design, develop, manufacture and market to customers and consumers, the most desirable frames and sunglasses in two fast growing segments: Luxury and Sport & Lifestyle.Through our industry expertise, we empower our brands to go beyond their limits in this high potential business category, supporting their capacity to lead and innovate in Eyewear, to realize their artistic and financial potential, in the most imaginative and sustainable manner.
Why work with us?

This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering Eyewear adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a thriving Company in a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

Title: 【招募】學生助理 / 兼職學生助理（沙田 / 深水埗 / 九龍城 / 屯門 / 元朗區幼稚園工作）
Company: The Education University of Hong Kong
Location: 幼稚園（沙田 / 深水埗 / 九龍城 / 屯門 / 元朗 區）
Job Description:
香港教育大學幼兒教育學系的研究團隊現正進行「賽馬會童亮計劃」（KeySteps@JC）的追蹤性研究，是次研究旨在制定一套全面支援基層幼童的方案，為其建立更強的成長基礎以承托其長遠發展。
研究團隊現正招募以下職位協助進行研究，想增加機會與小朋友接觸？加强認識學術研究？請立即加入教大的研究團隊！
職位
學生助理 / 兼職學生助理
報酬
時薪$74 + 5 % MPF
表現優異者可獲得參與證書
職責
在教大完成一次培訓（可獲2小時培訓津貼）
在幼稚園為K1-K3學生做個人評估
工作地點
幼稚園（沙田 / 深水埗 / 九龍城 / 屯門 / 元朗 區）
時間
彈性工作時間
培訓資訊
最新的培訓資訊將會在WhatsApp群組內發放。如有興趣，歡迎按以下連結進入群組了解最新培訓資訊。
培訓資訊 (WhatsApp群組)：https://bit.ly/keystep_training 
查詢
如有任何疑問，歡迎與KeySteps@JC教大研究團隊聯絡。
電郵：keysteps@eduhk.hk；
電話：2948 8854
--------------------
更多資訊
訂閱YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@KeyStepsatJC
追蹤Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/keysteps_at_jc/
追蹤Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/keystepsathkjc
Skills & Requirements:
現正修讀專上課程或以上學位
必須操流利廣東話
守時、有責任、有良好溝通技巧
有兒童工作經驗者優先
懂中文輸入法和基本電腦操作
Fields of Study: Counselling, Criminology, Psychology, Social Sciences, Social Work, Sociology, Speech-Language Pathology & Learning Disabilities, Health & Social Services Management, Chinese Language & Literature, Community Health Practice, Education, English
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Higher Diploma / Associate Degree, Bachelor, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company:
香港教育大學為一所政府資助的高等學府，致力透過提供師訓教育，以及社會科學和人文科學多元學術及研究課程，推動學與教的發展。
我們致力培育敏於思考、關懷社會及放眼世界的教育工作者及社會領袖，使之能夠服務社區，推動變革。我們尤著重研究實力 — 積極促進研究發展，提升知識、學術及創新，務求對社會與人類發展，作出不懈的貢獻。
我們專注教育領域的研究、發展及創新，並進一步加強本校在亞太地區及以外的先導地位。
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Mr Alvin So, Project Assistant, Department of Early Childhood Education

Title: Retail Sales Advisor / Tesla Advisor
Job Description:
The Role:
At Tesla, our Tesla Advisors / Sales Advisors consistently deliver an incredible educational, immersive, and exciting experience to all of our current and future customers. They constitute Tesla’s front line and are our brand ambassadors, supporting our mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy by creating memorable experiences for our customers.
As a Tesla Advisor / Sales Advisor, you will support customers from the moment they walk into our showrooms to learn about Tesla.  We have created one of the most innovative vehicles ever made, and you will help deliver an equally innovative buying experience. 
 Responsibilities:
Engage walk in guests promptly, personally and with the goal of opening the conversation and ensuring they feel welcome
Understand who our guests are, what brought them to Tesla, their intent and timeline to purchase, thus creating a robust Customer Profile
Educate and excite guests by answering their questions and providing a tailored experience based upon their interests and agenda
Demonstrate a mastery of all Tesla products and services, as well as local incentives for EV owners
Help Tesla maintain a healthy sales pipeline by collecting customer contact information and scheduling Test Drives for individuals who exhibit purchase intent or potential
Regularly update the CRM system to ensure accurate and timely sales and delivery information is available to management
Prepare vehicles and host delivery appointments, including new owner orientations tailored to the individual customer’s needs and comfort level
Skills & Requirements:
Requirements:
Customer service experience required
Positive, enthusiastic and passionate about the changes in the personal transportation industry
Ability to understand and convey business issues and technical concepts
Strong sense of team mentality and reliability
Strong communication skills and attention to detail
Demonstrate a mastery of all Tesla products and services. Keep up with EV industry trends and local incentives
Ability to work evenings and weekends
MUST have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record.
About Company:
Our mission is to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy. With global temperatures rising, the faster we free ourselves from fossil fuel reliance and achieve a zero-emission future, the better.
In pursuit of this mission, we make electric vehicles that are not just great EVs, but the best cars, period. We also produce and install infinitely scalable clean energy generation and storage products that help our customers further decrease their environmental impact. When it comes to achieving our goals, we pride ourselves in accomplishing what others deem impossible.
We are opening new factories and increasing our output everyday – join us in building a sustainable future.
Address: Tsuen Wan
Job Categories:
Customer Services - Retail / Hotel / Tourism and Others
Sales / Account Servicing / Business Development

Title: Permit Officer
Job Description:
Safety and Operational Risk Department is under Cathay Subsidiary Services umbrella providing services Cathay Pacific Airways Limited’s subsidiaries including Cathay Cargo Terminal, Cathay Dining, Hong Kong Airport Services Limited and Vogue Laundry Service Limited.   
Key Responsibilities 
To work under the direct supervision of the Senior Permit Officer, in his/her absence, the Security Specialist.  
To ensure the operation within the Cathay Cargo Terminal Permit Office is carried out smoothly and orderly.  
To process applications for Cathay Cargo Terminal permits in accordance with the Cathay Cargo Terminal TRA ASP.  
To be responsible for security check of all ID documents submitted for permit applications.  
To keep close contact with the Airport Authorities Hong Kong Permit Office and to process applications for ARA permits.  
To upkeep all permit application forms, supporting documents and training records in good order.   
Support other Cathay subsidiaries for matters of safety and security and completes other projects/ assignments as directed by the Safety and Security Manager.  
Any ad hoc duties as assigned by Superior(s).
Skills & Requirements:
Qualifications and Experience 
Tertiary or DSC level education qualification with working experience. Former security operations experience will be an advantage.  
Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese.  
Proficient in MS Office applications.  
Details oriented and shall be a self-motivated team player.  
Able to work independently and under pressure.  
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
About Company:
Cathay Pacific Catering Services (H.K.) Limited is one of the largest flight kitchens in the world with the largest catering facility at Hong Kong International Airport, producing a daily average of 83,000 meals daily and serving over 50 international airline clients with an order fulfillment of up to 200 flights daily.
We are looking for high caliber professionals to fill the following position. This position will be based at our facility at Hong Kong International Airport.
Application Methods: Please address your application to : People Department
Address: 11 Catering Road East Hong Kong International Airport Lantau Hong Kong

Title: Japanese Subtitle Editor | Translation | Media Subtitling
Job Description:
Role Description
The Subtitle Editor is responsible for translating and subtitling videos and related materials from English and Japanese into traditional Chinese, conducting proofreading for the translation files, and providing coaching for freelancers.
This role will work with a variety of different types of scripts for a range of local and international clients.
Capabilities & Skills
Demonstrate a proficient level of language skill in English, Japanese Cantonese, and Mandarin
Strong and consistent communication skills to build and nurture relationships with freelancers, rewriters, project managers and operational leadership as required to assist in meeting our delivery fulfilment deadlines
Language curiosity, to take responsibility and ownership of staying up to date with culture, media and language of the target area
Able to provide a strong delivery and operational leadership with an eye for detail. Edit text to established reading speeds, retaining the content and flavour of the source material, whilst ensuring that subtitles stay synchronised with the soundtrack and allow adequate access to picture and graphics
Skills & Requirements:
Degree holder in Translation, Journalism, Language or related disciplines
Certificate holder of N1
Practical work experience in media translation or proofreading
Excellent command of both written and oral Chinese, English and Mandarin
Strong sense of responsibility, able to work independently under minimum supervision
Immediate available is highly preferred
About Company: We are the leading provider of dubbing, subtitling, translation, access and media services to the world's most recognizable entertainment companies.
Note:
Application Interested parties please send your application with full CV including current and expected salary and availability to us.
Test will be sent to the shortlisted candidates.
All personal information will be treated strictly confidential and solely for recruitment purpose.
Job Categories: Journalist / Editor / Translation / Copy Writing / Communications

Casual attire allowed

GreenCo ESG Advisory Limited provides a wide range of sustainability and ESG solutions, including sustainability advisory, ESG reporting, ESG training and ESG assurance services. Our clients span small and medium-sized enterprises to multinational corporations and fund managers across diverse industry sectors located at Hong Kong, Mainland China and Southeast Asia. GreenCo has been accredited ISO9001 Certificate in ESG/Sustainability Reporting and Climate Change Policy Advisory. Joining our consulting team, you will be equipped with a highly professional toolkit in the field.
GreenCo and Valtech Valuation & Consulting (which focuses on advisory in valuation, research and risk consulting) are under the same family. Candidates will be working in a boutique firm with 10-20 employees with office in Hong Kong and the PRC.
Our consultants have strong academic backgrounds and professional qualifications, including PhD, master’s degrees in Environmental Assessment and Management, as well as CPA, CFA, FRM, Certificate in GRI Standards, Certificate in ESG Investing etc.
GreenCo is also a General Member of the Business Environment Council (BEC) and a GRI Community Member.

About Company:
Peak Reinsurance Company Limited (“Peak Re” or the “Company”) is a Hong Kong-based global reinsurance company. Since commencing its operations in 2012, the Company has grown steadily to rank 27th among global reinsurance groups in terms of net reinsurance premiums written. The Company reported a net profit after tax of USD160 million against reinsurance revenue of USD750 million in the first half of 2023 (six months ended 30 June 2023). With a total equity of USD1,260 million as of 30 June 2023, Peak Re enjoys an “A-” rating by AM Best. Peak Re is authorised by the Insurance Authority of Hong Kong under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41). The Company offers both Property & Casualty (“P&C”) and Life & Health (“L&H”) reinsurance. It strives to provide clients around the globe with innovative and tailored reinsurance, risk management and capital management solutions. Fosun International Limited (00656.HK) and Prudential Financial, Inc. hold approximately 87% and 13% of Peak Re via Peak Reinsurance Holdings Limited, respectively.

Title: Service Advisor
Job Description:
What to Expect:

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service.  This position is located at our Service Center in Hong Kong; however, the role will require travel as needed and directed by management.  If you are interested in becoming a part of a world class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you. 
What You’ll Do:
Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary.
Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle.
Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery.
Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer.
Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed. 
Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
Skills & Requirements:
What You’ll Bring
Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goals
Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
Associate Degree or certificate in Automotive Technology, or equivalent, preferred
Retail automotive service experience, preferred
Fluency in Chinese and English
About Company:
Our mission is to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy. With global temperatures rising, the faster we free ourselves from fossil fuel reliance and achieve a zero-emission future, the better.
In pursuit of this mission, we make electric vehicles that are not just great EVs, but the best cars, period. We also produce and install infinitely scalable clean energy generation and storage products that help our customers further decrease their environmental impact. When it comes to achieving our goals, we pride ourselves in accomplishing what others deem impossible.
We are opening new factories and increasing our output everyday – join us in building a sustainable future.
Address: Tsuen Wan

Title: Intern, Sales and Marketing (Return offer provided)
Job Description:
Role Description
We are looking for a passionate, self-motivated candidate to join our Business Development Department as the Sales and Marketing Intern. This internship position is a good opportunity to gain hands-on experience of GaoTeng products and services by supporting our business development initiatives.
We expect you to quickly learn our products and services in order to provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive sales and marketing support. To ensure you can fully immerse yourself in this role, we prefer you to be a final-year postgraduate student set to graduate in 2024 and able to intern full-time and on-site for at least 3 consecutive months.
Candidates who excel in this role will be considered for a full-time return offer.
  Key Responsibilities
Assist in preparing the company's marketing materials and pitching documents in both Chinese and English.
Assist in completing the official RFPs, RFIs, DDQs and related after-sales documents from domestic and foreign institutional customers.
Help compiling periodic sales related reports, management information and product performance statistics for market analysis or research.
Help tracking product performance, cooperate with the investment team, and respond to internal inquiries in a timely manner.
Help the corporate branding communications and marketing events.
Complete other tasks assigned by supervisors.
Skills & Requirements:
Knowledge/Skills
Master degree in Economics, Finance, Marketing, or other related disciplines.
A strong interest in financial markets is essential.
Great interpersonal skills and self-driven, able to understand task requirements and provide timely solutions.
Detail-oriented, meticulous, a good team player and fast learner, able to adapt to multi-task and fast-paced work requirements.
Fluent in English and Chinese with outstanding spoken and written skills.
Candidates with relevant internship experience are highly preferred.
Fields of Study: Accounting & Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, Communication, Global Economics & Finance
About Company:
GaoTeng Global Asset Management Limited (‘GaoTeng’) is an asset management company strategically invested by Hillhouse Capital Group and Tencent Holdings Limited. It has a top-tier asset management team with abundant investment experiences domestically and overseas. GaoTeng is ranked No.1 as the “Top Investment House in Asian G3 Bonds” (Hong Kong, Asset Managers) for both 2020 and 2021 by The Asset. In 2020, it is awarded by Asia Asset Management as “Asian Rising Star” and selected as “Asian Supernova of the Year” by Insights & Mandate. Headquartered in Hong Kong, the Company is currently licensed by Securities and Futures Commission for Type 1 (Dealing in Securities), Type 4 (advising on securities) and Type 9 (asset management) regulated activities*, registered at China Securities Regulatory Commission as Qualified Foreign Institutional Investor (QFII/RQFII) and qualified by Asset Management Association of China as a registered Hong Kong stock investment advisory institution. The Company’s subsidiary, GaoTeng Overseas Private Fund Management (Hainan) Ltd., has been registered amongst the first batch of Hainan Qualified Domestic Limited Partner (QDLP) Overseas Investment Pilot Enterprises by Hainan Local Financial Supervision Administration Bureau. Combining the superior investment ability of Hillhouse and pioneering internet technology of Tencent, we are committed to delivering top-notch asset management products and services with superior user experience to domestic and global investors.
*For Type 1 regulated activity, the licensee shall only carry on the business of dealing in collective investment schemes. The terms “collective investment scheme” and “dealing” are as defined under the Securities and Futures Ordinance.
高騰國際資產管理有限公司（“高騰國際”）是高瓴資本和騰訊戰略投資的資產管理公司，擁有一流的團隊，具備豐富的海內外投資管理經驗。高騰國際於2020及2021年蟬聯The Asset 評選的 “亞洲G3債券最佳投資機構”第一名（香港，資產管理組別），並於2020年獲亞洲資產管理頒評之“亞洲區最佳明日之星”及獲投資洞見與委託評選為“年度亞洲新星”。公司總部位於香港，已獲得香港證監會頒發的第1類（證券交易），第4類（就證券提供意見）和第9類（提供資產管理）牌照*，並獲中國證監會批准的合格境外投資者（QFII/RQFII）資格，以及由中國證券投資基金業協會頒發的港股投資顧問機構備案資質。公司控股的高騰海外私募基金管理（海南）有限公司是海南省合格境內有限合夥人（QDLP）首批試點企業。高騰國際借助高瓴資本優越的投資能力和騰訊領先的互聯網技術優勢，致力於為全球投資者提供優質便捷的投資產品與服務。
*就第1類受規管活動而言，持牌人只可經營集體投資計畫交易的業務。“集體投資計畫”及“交易”指《證券及期貨條例》所界定的涵義。

Title: Customer Service Officer - Fresh graduates are welcome
Job Description:
Job Summary
Do you want to work in a leading company in a prosperous Cloud Computing industry? We are seeking a driven and customer-oriented Customer Service Officer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will join our primary contact team to assist customers in onboarding their subscribed cloud computing services. You will be trained to be the first point of contact for customers with subscription and billing enquires and to provide them with great and friendly advice. You will learn the service provisioning knowledge about the latest cloud computing products from Microsoft. If you also want to gain valuable customer service experience in provisioning and supporting cloud computing services back-up by global cloud vendors like Microsoft – We want to hear from you!
Roles and Responsibilities:
Validate and process orders for cloud service subscriptions 
Adhere to prescribed procedures and workflows to accurately complete tasks within committed timelines and service levels 
Coordinate service provision for customer orders using integrated business support system and vendor ordering platforms 
Assign, monitor, and escalate dispatched tasks to technical teams and vendors related to service provision
Handle customer contract renewals and cultivate long-term relationships with customers 
Provide first-level customer service, manage hotlines, handle inquires, and assist with billing support for customers
Assist in preparing accurate & timely reports 
Handle ad hoc assignments and other duties as required
Skills & Requirements:
We are looking for: 
Higher Diploma or above in any discipline
At least 2 years of experience in customer service, preferably with experience on handling order processing
Fluent in Cantonese, Mandarin and English
Good command of written Chinese and English
Good communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
A warm, approachable and helpful manner
Passionate, hardworking, patient and willing to learn
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Outlook
Candidate with more experience will be considered as Senior Customer Service Officer
Fresh graduates are welcome
Benefits: 
Annual leave, birthday leave, work anniversary leave, examination leave, and other welfare leaves
Attractive remuneration package
Staff buddy Program and regular team-building activities
Continuous sponsorship for the latest cloud technologies training
Opportunity to advance your knowledge and expertise in cloud technologies
Who are we?
Employer of Choice Award and Innovative Technology Deployment Award Winner
Top Award of Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider Direct Partner
Best Managed Service Provider Partner
Largest Cloud Hosting business in Hong Kong since 2008
Mission to empower customers to #WORKSMARTER with cloud solutions and IT services
Workplace encourages passion, efficiency, judgment, involvement, and development
Join our team and be part of our success story! Apply now and take your career to new heights in the exciting world of Customer Service and cloud technologies.
Interested parties, please send your latest resume with present and expected salary by clicking APPLY NOW. All applications will be treated in strict confidence and for recruitment purposes only. Only shortlisted candidates would be contacted.
About Company:
A New Generation IT outsourcing company, or Cloud Hosting Service Provider, in Asia is looking for the right candidate to promote our Hosting Solution targeting Enterprise market. We are seeking for candidates who present themselves with strong communication and interpersonal skills along with excellence in self-motivation; and a positive, energetic, and ambitious attitude in the IT industry.
Superhub is a leading Microsoft Cloud Hosting Solution provider offering private and public cloud solution to Hong Kong and Multi-National companies in Greater China Region. We are serving 140,000 enterprise users with 3 data centers and 7x24 supports. Our 99.99% uptime guarantee and same day hardware replacement service give peace mind, reliable and always-on service to customer anywhere online.

Title: Used Car Advisor
Job Description:
The Role
Tesla is looking to reinvent the used car buying experience, and we are looking for innovators to help us in this endeavor. At Tesla, our Used Car Advisors consistently deliver on an incredible educational, immersive, and exciting experience to all our current and future customers as well as create a memorable experience for our customers on delivery day. They will partner with local sales, service, and remarketing team members to revolutionize the customer experience around purchasing a pre-owned car.
Responsibilities
Serve as the primary point of contact to manage escalations, addressing customer concerns, compliance matters, and resolving any priorities related to the Used Car/trade-in business
Drive operational excellence by developing and monitoring Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s), such as sales volume, revenue, gross margin, customer satisfaction, and inventory turn/dwell, to identify trends and areas for improvement
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align strategies, anticipate operational risks, and implement solutions that improve workflows
Collaborate with Delivery Department to meet and exceed quarterly delivery goals
Develop and execute long-term strategic plans to scale Tesla’s trade-in business multiple times over, considering relevant overlaps with other Tesla departments, market trends, customer experience, and technology/resourcing
Demonstrate strong presentation skills to deliver clear and concise information, effectively conveying complex ideas and strategies to various stakeholders within the organization
Skills & Requirements:
Requirements
Passion for Tesla's mission and products, and a desire to share this with others
Excellent communication skills and the ability to build rapport with customers
The ability to explain complex topics to customers in simple terms
Focus on educating and understanding customers' needs
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment, and prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines
Project and program management experience with the ability to apply excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with a data-driven mindset towards multiple initiatives simultaneously
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Fluent in spoken and written English
Driving license holder would be an advantage
Knowledge of the used car industry, including pricing strategies, vehicle evaluation, and remarketing

Title: TRAINEE: Communications Surveillance Analyst
Job Description:
Bring a solid previous experience that will benefit the Benchmark Fixings and Market Abuse communications surveillance frameworks
Undertake focused electronic communication monitoring on other key focus areas (Market Misconduct, Chinese Wall, Financial Crime, General Misconduct...) as required
Maintain and monitor a database of remedial actions/recommendations arising from communication monitoring, to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution of issues identified
Promptly undertake communications surveillance using the firm’s oral and written communications surveillance tools as instructed by the APAC Head of Communications Surveillance, as appropriate
Promptly investigate and clearly communicate issues arising from the surveillance activities, involving advisory compliance as required, and follow issues through full resolution with the business lines as appropriate
Proactively and timely escalate issues to APAC CMS Management as required, ensuring regular and frequent communication on such issues
The role involves autonomy on a day-to-day basis, but active liaison with the team supervisor as appropriate
Actively participate in regulatory and internal investigations as required
Any other tasks / projects as assigned
Candidates with outstanding performance will be considered for early conversion to permanent roles.
What We Offer
Your life doesn’t revolve around your job. So, find the job that revolves around your life.

Product knowledge (structured products, equities, fixed income, currencies, commodities)
Necessary to understand communications of Front Officers and transactions on complex products.
Tenacity and being results oriented

The candidate will be required to exercise judgement on regulatory risks. It is essential to our everyday activities in Compliance. He / she needs to be curious and proactive in raising questions, concerns and deliver quality analysis in a timely manner.
Adaptability
The candidate will operate within a multi-jurisdiction platform and deal with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and culture.
Highly adaptable, well-organised and able to multitask.
Oral and written communication
Communication is at the center of what we do every day. The candidate must be fluent in English, Cantonese and Mandarin,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Chinese (Traditional and Simplified). This is a MUST HAVE skill.
Strong analytical, problem solving skills, well-organised and able to multitask.
Analytical skills and ability to summarize key messages
The candidate will be entrusted with projects and tasks of his/her own and his / her manager will expect to receive very clear and concise feedback on the work progress.
Proficiency in Word / PowerPoint / Excel including Macro
Required to be able to compute data and perform some analysis on raw data.
Languages
Fluency in English, Cantonese and Mandarin.
Behavioral Skills

Team Spirit - Open mindset: I listen and share my views and my expertise in an open mode
Innovation - Thinking out of the box/Creativity: I propose new ideas and solutions

Title: Algorithm Engineer
Job Description: This is a highly multi-functional product development role, and you will work closely with various teams, like Silicon Design, Product Architecture, QA, the ML Frameworks team. The environment is dynamic and requires a self-starter demeanor. In this role, you will: Develop new algorithm prototype model for future products from prototyping phases, through to mass production, while maintaining existing drivers across a whole range of Acamar products. Develop APIs for Neural engine applications, be involved in neural engine feature specifications, pre-silicon validation, silicon bring-up, and tools creation. Work on HW validation, and provide software support to factory testing. You will also implement features to support hardware testing and diagnosis.
Skills & Requirements:
• Excellent programming skills and knowledge of C/C++, Python, Verilog is a plus
• Strong Python programming experience with software design skills
• Experience with deep neural network training, inference and optimization in leading frameworks(e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow)
• Familiarity with deep learning techniques, convolutional neural networks(CNNs), recurrent neural networks(RNNs), and transformer models
• 2+ years related embedded system development experience on Windows and Linux
• Excellent debugging, and problem solving capabilities
• Experience in hardware/software co-simulation, and pre-silicon validation
• Excellent understanding of the mathematical foundations of machine learning and deep learning
• Self-motivation combined with team spirit and the urge to learn new things and solve hard problems
• Good written and oral interpersonal skills
Fields of Study: Artifical Intelligence: Systems & Technologies, Big Data Technology, Computer Science & Engineering, Computing Mathematics, Computing & Software Technologies, Electrical / Electronic / Energy Engineering
About Company:
Acamar is a high-tech company dedicated to the development of image processing algorithms and video codec algorithms. We continue to do in-depth research in the direction of computer arithmetic and modern computing camera algorithms. Acamar has formed a series of intellectual property rights (IP CORE) and has completed verification on FPGA platform and ASIC platform.
The core competitiveness and value of Acamar lie in advancement and high efficiency of our algorithms and low-power hardware implementation.
In the direction of image processing algorithms, Acamar carries out R&D in the following areas: AI ISP, optical flow calculation, HDR, multi-camera synchronization, 4K/8K processing, auto-focus, stereo vision, 3D noise reduction, etc.
In the direction of video codec, Acamar concentrates on algorithm optimization research for H.264, H.265, H.266, AV1 and VR/3D video compression, such as unique intra-frame pattern determination and efficient inter-frame motion estimation algorithms, as well as implementation of transform coding and entropy coding.

About Company:
聯合出版（集團）有限公司係1988年在港組建。旗下香港三聯書店、香港中華書局、香港商務印書館等多家知名出版機構服務香港已逾百年，現已發展成為香港最具規模和影響力的綜合性出版傳媒集團。集團總部設在中國香港，在中國內地和港澳台地區，以及美國、加拿大、新加坡、馬來西亞、印尼等地設有子公司和分支機構。
  ——集團始終堅持「以文化人、以書立社」，身體力行「中華文化傳播者、世界文明融合者、香港社會建設者」社會責任，努力體現「全球視野、世界格局、中國氣派、香港特色」。
   ——集團大力踐行｢精準、精細、精品、精湛｣出版理念，旗下香港三聯書店、香港中華書局、香港商務印書館，以及萬里機構、新雅文化、新民主出版社、教圖公司、中和出版、聯合培進等出版機構和《讀書雜誌》、《美術家》、《小跳豆》等期刊，「深耕香港、面向世界、注重原創、兼顧引進」，與讀者、學者、著者、譯者結下深厚情緣，享有良好口碑。
   ——集團建成出版物發行零售連鎖書店，運營「一本」「知書」等互聯網平台，深度推進「渠道變革、業態創新、科技驅動、管理升級」，加快實施品牌驅動和一體化運營，打通線下與線上，連接實體與虛擬，打造粵港澳大灣區特色書店和閱讀推廣新高地。
   ——集團大力支持中華商務聯合印刷公司加快落實「傳統核心主業、科技新興業態、資本創新經營」三足鼎立發展格局，建立「全面營銷體系」，加快向涵蓋書刊、商業、安全、包裝印刷以及多種印前印後服務的「全面印刷方案」現代企業轉型，努力建成具有全球競爭力和創造價值的印刷資訊傳播企業。

  面向未來，集團致力於戰略創新，努力構建「出版主業、現代印刷、新零售、新媒體新業態與新業務、資產經營與資本經營」五大業務板塊和北京紫荊文化廣場、廣州南沙產業基地為一體的現代出版傳媒產業體系，致力於加快實現以香港為產業中心，以粵港澳大灣區為發展半徑，以大中華區為影響力領域，主業突出、品牌優秀、業態先進、產業鏈完整、核心競爭力強勁的出版傳媒領軍企業的宏偉願景。

About Company:
Azeus Systems Limited is a leading IT services provider with more than 30 years of experience in successfully delivering IT solutions to various clients in Asia Pacific and the UK. Established in 1991, Azeus now operates in Hong Kong, the United Kingdom, the Philippines, China (Dalian), Australia and Malaysia. Throughout the years, Azeus has delivered 250 IT projects to over 60 government departments and public authorities in Hong Kong and the United Kingdom. The software products we developed have also achieved an international customer base spanning over 30 countries in both the public and commercial sectors.

In 2003, CMM was updated to CMMI (Capability Maturity Model Integration), and Azeus was the first company in Hong Kong that got the highest level of CMMI Version 1.1, and the subsequent 1.2 and 1.3 in 2007 and 2012 respectively. These signify the high quality of our products and services.

Title: Finance Officer/ Assistant Manager (Temporary)
Job Description:
Role Summary:
  As a Temporary Finance Officer/ Assistant Manager, you will be instrumental in the transition from the Sage accounting system to Workday. Your primary responsibilities will include assisting in the migration of financial data, collaborating with the accounting team to configure Workday modules, implementing new accounting processes in Workday, performing day-to-day accounting activities, and maintaining accurate financial records.
  Key Responsibilities:
  Assist in the transition from Sage to Workday accounting system, ensuring a smooth and accurate migration of financial data.
Collaborate with the accounting team to ensure proper setup and configuration of Workday system modules related to general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and other relevant areas.
Conduct data validation and reconciliation exercises between Sage and Workday to identify any discrepancies and ensure data integrity.
Assist with the implementation of new accounting processes and procedures within the Workday system.
Perform day-to-day accounting activities, including but not limited to processing invoices, reconciling accounts, and preparing financial reports.
Support the month-end and year-end closing processes in both the old and new systems, ensuring timely and accurate financial reporting.
Maintain accurate and organized financial records and documentation.
Skills & Requirements:
Key Skills & Required experience:
  A bachelor’s degree in accounting is often required.
Relevant working experience preferable
Hands-on experience in preparing financial documents, reports, and analyses
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
Team player
Proficiency in excel, word and PowerPoint software
Experience in Sage or workday is particularly preferable
Attention to details
Immediate available is highly preferred
  For any interested party, please send your CV to apcareers@conning.com

Good interpersonal skills.
Self-motivation and detail-mindedness.

About Company:
DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion.
The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains.

Title: Intern, Supply Chain Digital Asia Pacific (Ref: CEDS) (9-12 months full time internship)
Job Description:
The Supply Chain Digital team aims to add value to our internal & external customers as we are working highly customer centric by providing advanced digital solutions addressing customer's needs.
The incumbent will develop and deploy low-code automation solutions for processes, provide internal support on our digital tools & platform, screen the market for potential new tools, as well as hands on weekly KPI reporting and newsletter preparation.
Job duties & involvements:
Develop resilient robotic process automations with low-code tools (UiPath Studio, PowerAutomate) based on business user requirements
Test process automations and conduct user acceptance tests (UAT)
Interact with business requestors to ensure automation is designed according to their needs
Provide administrative support to manage automation solution pipeline, resource planning
Execute and maintain automation solutions on as-needed basis
Screen market for new trends in process automation tools and other digital trends through various channels
Provide data aggregation and analysis to support management decision making
Independently handle assigned tasks, and proactively seek support as required
Provide administrative supports to the team leader on team management initiatives, events and activities
Measure, monitor and analyze KPI, initiate necessary actions to identify root causes by collaborating with corresponding partners
Compile and present observations and proposals to the team leader
Manage/support regular operations activities
Skills & Requirements:
Requirements:
Year 2 or above undergraduate students in Computer Science, Information Systems, Supply Chain, Logistics, Operations Management or equivalent
Tech Savvy with understanding of and experience with low-code development tools
High willingness to learn and a fast learner
Confident and open-minded with good communication and interpersonal skills
Creative thinking, able to solve problems in complex environment
Self-motivated and energetic, be accountable for actions and results, successes and failures
Fluent at spoken and written English and Mandarin
Experience in UiPath Studio and Microsoft PowerAutomate or other robotic process automation software is a big plus
Proficiency in MS office software, Tableau is a plus
Commitment to a full time internship for 9-12 months (Monday to Friday, 8:30am- 5:30pm) ** This is not a summer internship **
Priority would be given to students who can commit a longer internship period
For application, please send us your CV together with the latest transcript. Kindly indicate your availability in your application.
Fields of Study: Computer & Information Sciences, Industrial & Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Information System Management, Logistics / Supply Chain Management, Shipping Technology & Management
About Company:
We are Covestro. We are curious. We are courageous. We are colorful.
We redefine chemical material solutions. Innovation is our DNA. We change our industry with hightech polymer products. We are driven by the desire to grow. But we are going to do it our way – with smart technologies and products that we are proud of. Products that MAKE our world better.
Innovation that benefit our society and the environment. The future will be what WE MAKE it.
Together we will MAKE the world a brighter place.
